item.title: Enotria: The Last Song - All Status Effects, Explained
item.description:
To progress through Enotria: The Last Song story without any bosses or enemies giving you trouble, you have to understand the game’s Elements and Status Effect. There are four different Elements with each one of them having an advantage over the other, creating balanced combat mechanics.

Not only that, but Elements apply debuffs on enemies, which further helps clear their areas faster. They’re not only debuffs as each Status Effect offers a negative and a positive effect.

All Status Effects In Enotria: The Last Song

Each time you or your enemies land an Elemental attack, it will start building a Status Effect. Once that Status Effect meter is complete, you or the enemy will be affiliated with that Status Effect.

Dizzy

You trigger Dizzy on enemies when you hit them with weapons infused with Vis. While it increases their damage, it also notably reduces their defense, which opens a window to deal as much damage as possible. You can also trigger Dizzy on yourself by using a specific Item. During that time, you also have your damage increased alongside your Stamina regenerating much faster . On the other hand, you also suffer from the defense reduction that comes with the Dizzy Effects Status in Enotria: The Last Song .

Wicked

You trigger Wicked on enemies when your attacks and thrown items deal Fatuo damage. During that state, enemies’ Elemental damage is enhanced. However, your hits also heal you , which creates a situation where aggressiveness is more favorable. If you’re looking to maximize your Elemental damage, then use an item that inflicts Wicked on your character. This method is super effective as long the enemy is not hitting you, or they’ll also regain HP and that will make them harder to take down.

Radiant

You trigger Radiant on enemies when you hit them with items and weapons infused with Gratia. When you trigger Radiant, enemies start recovering HP over time. However, once you land a hit on them, they’ll explode and cause massive damage. If you’re near the explosion, it will knock you back from the impact. You can also trigger Radiant on yourself, which will also heal you over time . But, as not everything is perfect, once you get hit, you’ll trigger an explosion that will hurt you and any enemy around you.

Sick

You trigger Sick when you keep hitting enemies with items and weapons infused with Malanno. During the duration when enemies are Sick, they constantly lose HP like Poison in Elden Ring . Triggering Sick on your character turns them into a walking killing machine. Your character will start dealing damage over time to any enemy close to them .

item.title: The Biggest PS5 Game File Sizes (& How Many GB They Take Up)
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • PlayStation 5 fans may have to buy additional NVMe SSD hard drives for more space.
  • Some PS5 games have massive file sizes, with Horizon Forbidden West requiring close to 100 GB of space due to its amazing graphics.
  • Games like WWE 2K23 and Assassin's Creed Valhalla take up a significant amount of space on PS5, likely due to enhanced graphics and extensive content.

Within the early days of the PlayStation 5 , there has been a lot of talk about the variety of features it has and what it lacks. Notably, one of the biggest complaints coming out of the gate from PlayStation fans is the lack of viable storage options provided to players thus far.

The system has about 825 gigabytes available on its SSD. Of course, this doesn't mean that players will have all 825 GB to use. Players will only have a maximum of 667 GB available to them and must buy a compatible NVMe SSD hard drive if they want more space. This isn't possible for everyone, so it's important to look at the biggest file sizes for PS5 games to see what players should prioritize.

Updated September 15, 2024, by Gerardo Molina: While new solutions for the ongoing PlayStation 5 storage problem have become available over the years since it was released, others have unfortunately arisen. Most additional storage methods for the PlayStation 5 are still very expensive, and even if players manage to afford them, installing them can be challenging and might endanger the console's warranty if things aren't done correctly. That, combined with the fact that games are getting increasingly larger in file size, makes for a complicated situation for both Sony and PS5 owners.

20 Horizon Forbidden West

99.3 GB

Horizon Forbidden West is the much-awaited sequel to Aloy's first adventure. Just like its predecessor, it came out around the worst time possible when another genre-defining game was making its debut.

Still, Forbidden West is a fun game to get into, even if the title itself isn't all that innovative. It's clear to see why this game requires close to 100 GB of free space on the PS5, with its amazing graphics and high-quality textures needing this much space to shine on the hardware.

19 Marvel's Spider-Man: Miles Morales Ultimate Launch Edition

105 GB

In Marvel's Spider-Man: Miles Morales Ultimate Launch Edition , players will step into the shoes of Miles, Peter Parker's young protégé. Miles is tasked with protecting New York in Peter's absence, and throughout the story, players will see Miles' growth as a superhero in many aspects.

When it comes to PS5 game sizes, this title doesn't have enough to make it to the top of the list, especially when there are games over the 300 GB mark. That said, its whopping 105 GB still represents 15% of the console's total usable storage capacity (667.2 GB), meaning that players can only install another five games of a similar size without a memory expansion solution, which is very inconvenient.

18 F1 2021

113.1 GB

In terms of PS5 game sizes , there is always an iterative sports title that makes the list as these tend to be packed with content. One of the biggest sports titles on the PS5 right now, purely by file size, is F1 2021 . The latest Codemasters title based on the popular racing circuit brings many of the things players have liked in the past and added some new features as well.

Among the new features is a new story experience called "Braking Point." In addition, the game features two new modes that players can try. One is a career mode where two players can play together. The other is a "Real Season-Start," which puts players back in time to the start of the F1 season to see them crown a new champion. F1 2021 is 113.1 GB on PS5.

17 Ghost Of Tsushima: Director's Cut

113.6 GB

With the release of the PS5, some of the greatest games from the previous generation were re-released on the newer console with enhanced graphics and some new content. One of these games released was Ghost of Tsushima: Director's Cut , an expanded version of the hit Sucker Punch game.

This version features all the content that was originally in the open-world experience, but it includes an entirely new side area called Iki Island. Other additions to the game include a full Japanese lip sync for players who want to be fully immersed in the game's setting. Ghost of Tsushima: Director's Cut currently sits at 113.6 GB needed.

16 WWE 2K23

118.7 GB

After a few rough years, WWE fans have been enjoying better wrestling games as of late, including the latest entry in WWE 2K23 . Clocking in at 118.7 GB, it is also one of the biggest entries to date, likely for the enhanced graphics and the massive roster of wrestlers that will continue to grow.

Along with many returning features, stand-out modes in WWE 2K23 include an interactive documentary where players can live through the career of the great John Cena while playing the game from his opponent's perspective. In addition, there is WarGames mode that features steel cage matches with up to fourteen players across two rings at once.

15 NBA 2K25

120 GB (Minimum)

NBA 2K25 was recently released, and it brought tons of new and improved game mechanics and elements that fans are greatly enjoying. Not only did this installment of the franchise bring back The Auction House, but it also introduced a new dribbling engine that allows players to have more control of the ball during matches. This title also features ray tracing in "The City," and has improved player models and animations.

With a considerable minimum requirement of 120 GB, NBA 2K25 is significantly large, especially considering that further add-ons and updates could potentially raise this past NBA 2K24 's massive 156GB.

14 Metro Exodus

121.8 GB

Although it may not seem like the type of game that would take up a ton of space, Metro Exodus has a PS5 game size of 121.8 GB. While this is one of the biggest games on PS5, it may be worth downloading if players enjoy first-person shooters or games with a strong narrative.

Metro Exodus is the final chapter in a trilogy based on novels written by Dmitry Glukhovsky. The survival horror game has players exploring linear levels attempting to survive a world filled with creatures and humans who want to hurt the player.

13 Call Of Duty: Vanguard

123.1 GB

Despite not being the biggest Call of Duty game on the PS5, Call of Duty: Vanguard does require users to have a decent amount of space put aside for it on the console. It is the latest entry in the series and the first game from Sledgehammer Games since their last World War 2 title in 2017.

Much of the gameplay remains the same from previous entries in the franchise, but some new additions to the gameplay experience include being able to destroy walls and climb over objects instead of taking the normal paths. But what makes Call of Duty: Vanguard 123.1 GB is all the various modes in the game, from the normal campaign to multiplayer to the co-op Zombies mode.

12 The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt

127.8 GB

The third main installment in the beloved franchise by CD Projekt Red, The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt has players exploring the world and taking on the most brutal of monsters. The entire package on the PS5 is about 127.8 GB after this next-gen version was released near the end of 2022.

The main quest of The Witcher 3 revolves around Geralt of Rivia's mission to find his adoptive daughter, Ciri, who is being tracked down by the Wild Hunt. The complete edition on PS5 includes enhanced visuals and also includes a quest that is inspired by the hit Netflix show.

11 Destiny 2

139.8 GB

Bungie was recently acquired by Sony to work on multiplayer games on multiple platforms, but before that point, they have been working on and continuing to release expansions for their multiplayer looter shooter Destiny 2 .

The MMO offers three classes for players to choose from as they serve as heroes defending the Last City. Along with many cooperative and competitive modes, Destiny 2's many expansions have given players hours of content to continue the Destiny 2 storyline. It is likely this reason why the game is sitting at 139.8 GB on PS5.

10 Assassin's Creed Valhalla

140.4 GB

Speaking of open-world games, no company has embraced the genre harder than Ubisoft has. One of the biggest open-worlds the company has ever published comes in the latest entry of their biggest franchise: Assassin's Creed Valhalla .

The game takes place in the 870s. Players take control of Eivor, a Viking who is setting up their England and who becomes involved in the rivalry between the Templar Order and the Assassin Brotherhood. Assassin's Creed Valhalla has a massive world with plenty of activities to take part in, which may be why the game needs 140.4 GB to install and enjoy.

9 Star Wars Jedi: Survivor

147.6 GB

Star Wars Jedi: Fallen Order was an excellent game that players could enjoy quite a bit once they looked past its many bugs at launch. The sequel, Jedi: Survivor , ran poorly on PCs, but the console versions were relatively stable at the time of release.

The game takes up a lot of space but justifies this by showing just how much of a step up the title is from a visual standpoint. Jedi: Survivor 's legacy may be tarnished because of a horrid PC port, but players invested in Cal Kestis' journey will love the story's continuation and its fun action set-pieces.

8 Call Of Duty: Modern Warfare 2

150.8 GB

Infinity Ward has been developing Call of Duty from the very beginning and, after a couple of entries without being the main studio behind them, finally made their first PS5 Call of Duty game with the release of Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 2 .

A sequel to the reboot of the Modern Warfare franchise, the main campaign is focused on two forces who are hunting down Hassan Zyani, a leading member of the Iranian Quds Force who is armed with American missiles. The game also features many multiplayer modes, including its battle royale. The game requires 150.8 GB to install.

7 NBA 2K23

152.2 GB

In terms of annual sports releases, NBA 2K23 is one of the biggest file sizes ever. Sitting at a whopping 152.2 GB, the Visual Concepts title made some minor changes and continues to improve its graphics, but two key additions and updates define this entry.

The first is the return of the Jordan Challenge. In NBA 2K23 , players can go back to 1982 and play in a basketball game with Michael Jordan. In addition to this return, the MyNBA career mode has been revamped to include four different starting points for players to choose from.

6 Far Cry 6

158.7 GB

Returning to Ubisoft, while Assassin's Creed Valhalla is one of the biggest games Ubisoft has ever made, Far Cry 6 is right there with it and has an even bigger PS5 file size. With all the content currently in the game, Far Cry 6 has a current installment size of 158.7 GB.

Set on the fictional island of Yara, players take on the role of Dani Rojas as they try to free the country from the dictatorship of Antón Castillo. The open-world game has plenty of activities for Dani to take part in, which include various combat scenarios and fun challenges with a range of different weapons to use.

5 Cyberpunk 2077

159.6 GB

While not living up to the level that many players thought the game was going to be, Cyberpunk 2077 did deliver a large world that takes up plenty of space on the PS5 drive at 159.6 GB. The latest game from CD Projekt Red, Cyberpunk 2077 takes place in a futuristic civilization set in the universe inspired by the tabletop role-playing game of a similar name.

The game is yet another open world as there are various regions for the player to explore. While there is a main quest to focus on, there are various side activities that help keep the game interesting as well. Players can choose from a variety of different roles and approaches that can help tailor their experience to something unique to them.

4 The Elder Scrolls Online

168 GB

Considering it is a genre that is meant to hook players for a ridiculous amount of hours, it is unsurprising that an MMORPG would be on a list of PS5 game sizes. What is surprising is that only one of these games made the list, which is The Elder Scrolls Online .

Initially released in 2014, this spin-off entry of a beloved Bethesda property puts players on the continent of Tamriel. It lets them experience storylines that have some ties to the worlds and characters that they interacted with in previous entries of the series. As of the time of this writing, The Elder Scrolls Online sits at 168 GB, but this will change with future updates.

3 Marvel's Avengers

192 GB

As a live service game, it is understandable that Marvel's Avengers has a large file size given all the updates that have been brought to the game since its initial 2020 release. As of the game's latest update, the game requires players to have 192 GB free on their device to be able to become their favorite Marvel superheroes.

Marvel's Avengers is an action-adventure game that has a central campaign that can be played with more than one player. However, the content that has been added over the years included story expansions for Kate Bishop, Black Panther, Spider-Man, and more. Future updates may still be coming for those who own the game, so it's good to have more space available.

2 Gran Turismo 7

196.8 GB

There have only been a handful of completely new games released by PlayStation Studios since the launch of the new console, but only Gran Turismo 7 makes the biggest PS5 game file size list. Once again developed by Polyphony Digital, the newest entry in the classic racing franchise brings a next-generation take on its celebration of vehicles.

Gran Turismo 7 brings back many of the features that made its previous entries so enticing, but it also includes a lot of upgrades such as ray-tracing and DualSense support that take advantage of the controller's technology. Those who want to dive into the game will need to have 196.8 GB free on their storage space.

1 Call Of Duty: Black Ops Cold War

312.6 GB

Vanguard takes up a lot of space, but the largest Call of Duty game on the system is double the latest entry. Call Of Duty: Black Ops Cold War continued the trend from its predecessor, Call of Duty: Modern Warfare , with ridiculously gigantic file sizes that will eat away at the PlayStation 5's SSD.

This is likely due to the number of game modes the installment has, as well as taking into account the game's upgraded graphics. The game currently clocks in at a whopping 312.6 GB minimum, which makes this the biggest game on PS5, even after many games have been released since then.

item.title: New Call of Duty: Warzone Map Could Feature a Black Ops 4 Throwback
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • The Hacienda map from Black Ops 4 may feature in Warzone's Avalon map, according to a leak.
  • Fans are excited about the potential return of the iconic Black Ops 4 map.
  • Speculation about the Avalon map release date remains uncertain.

As per a new leak, the popular Hacienda map from Call of Duty: Black Ops 4 could be featured in the upcoming Avalon map for Call of Duty: Warzone . So far, the developers have not revealed when Avalon will be coming to Call of Duty: Warzone or even confirmed its existence, but the assets found by the community over the past few months strongly suggest that it is in development.

With the release of Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 around the corner, fans are quite curious to learn more about the future of Call of Duty: Warzone as well. Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 has enjoyed significant success in the beta phase, shattering several records to become the most popular beta in the history of the franchise. Amid that, some interesting details have emerged about the upcoming Call of Duty: Warzone map, which has been amid rumors for quite a while now.

In a new tweet, Call of Duty leaker Realityuk_ revealed that a fan-favorite map could be coming to Call of Duty: Warzone . The tweet features an alleged overhead view of the Avalon map in Call of Duty: Warzone and showcases the Hacienda estate from Call of Duty: Black Ops 4 . The media in the tweet has been taken down due to a copyright strike, consolidating the leak's credibility. That being said, players can find the leaked screenshot over on the CoDCompetitive subreddit.

Call of Duty: Warzone Fans Request for More Maps to be Added to Avalon

Fans are already quite excited about the return of the map, with many even stating that they would get back to Call of Duty: Warzone to experience the iconic Call of Duty: Black Ops 4 map. Some are even requesting for more maps to be added, with the likes of Frequency, Firing Range, and Fringe being some of the popular choices. However, it is crucial to note that from the looks of the picture, the map still appears quite incomplete, so it is quite possible that the rumored late 2025 release date for Call of Duty: Warzone's Avalon map might not be that reliable after all.

Some fans are still quite skeptical about whether Hacienda will actually make a return, but in fact, it doesn't seem quite far-fetched. This is because leakers had previously suggested that Hacienda will be making a comeback in Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 itself as a remastered map alongside some more popular maps like Dig, WMD, Yemen, and others. For now, Call of Duty: Warzone fans are awaiting the return of Verdansk which is confirmed to be returning in Spring 2025.

item.title: Satisfactory: How to Get Automated Wiring
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How to Craft Automated Wiring in Satisfactory
  • How to Set Up Automated Wiring Automation in Satisfactory

Automated Wiring is one of the required Project Assembly parts that players must craft to complete Phase 2 of Satisfactory . Things get tricky, however, once you realize that, similar to Smart Plating, Automated Wiring can't be crafted manually. Instead, you'll need to set up a fully automated system in the Assembler to get your hands on this essential resource.

Setting up an automated production system in Satisfactory can seem complicated at first. But once you know the materials you need and break them down into their core components, things become a lot clearer. For those struggling, here's how to get Automated Wiring in Satisfactory .

How to Craft Automated Wiring in Satisfactory

Automated Wiring can only be crafted by the Assembler . That means Pioneers won't be able to craft it manually on the workbench. Instead, they must build an automated manufacturing system via the Assembler to get their hands on it. The recipe to craft Automated Wiring is unlocked once pioneers reach Tier 4 Milestone 3, called Basic Steel Production .

To construct Automated Wiring, you'll need to feed the Assembler with the following resources:

  • 1x Stator (2.5 per minute)
  • 20x Cable (50 per minute)

How to Set Up Automated Wiring Automation in Satisfactory

You'll need three key resources to craft Automated Wiring: Iron Ore , Copper Ore , and Coal . Copper Ore is used to produce Wire, which is the only ingredient that you’ll need to craft Cable . Iron Ore and Coal can be turned into Steel Ingot , which is used to make Steel Pipe . You'll then have to feed it into an Assembler along with Wire to make a Stator .

There are plenty of ways you can set up an efficient Automated Wiring production system in Satisfactory . Here's a basic structure to help you get started:

  • Place three storage containers and fill them up with Iron Ore, Copper Ore, and Coal.
  • Build a Smelter and connect it to the Storage Container with Copper Ore using a Conveyor Belt. Set the Smelter to produce Copper Ingots.
  • Build a Constructor in front of the Smelter, connect the two buildings using a belt, and feed the Copper Ingots into the Smelter to craft Wire.
  • From the Constructor, build a belt and attach it to a Conveyor Splitter. From one end of the Splitter, build another belt and feed it into a second Constructor. Set the second Constructor to produce Cable.
  • Send the Cable to one of the Assembler's input ports. Now, you need to ensure the supply of Stators.
  • Build a Foundry and supply it with Iron Ore and Coal from your Storage Container to craft Steel Ingots.
  • Send the Steel Ingots to a Constructor and select the Steel Pipe recipe.
  • Build a secondary Assembler and send the Steel Pipe to one end of the Assembler.
  • Send the wires from the Conveyor Splitter you built earlier to the second Assembler. It now has the resources to craft Stators.
  • Send the Stators to the final Assembler in the chain and set it to craft Automated Wiring.

Crafting Automated Wiring can drain Copper Ore quickly. So, it's best to set up the production plant near a Copper node and build a Miner to feed it directly to the Smelter.

In Satisfactory , players have complete freedom to build and design their HUB any way they want, and this Automated Wiring production system can serve as a baseline to help you set up an efficient system to craft this essential Project Assembly part.

item.title: 8 Best Cooking Recipes In Fields Of Mistria
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Cooking various recipes in Fields of Mistria can help players replenish health and stamina, with easy options like Trail Mix and Sliced Turnip.
  • Summer introduces new food sources like Coconut Milk, Grilled Corn, and Green Tea, providing stamina and selling for a profit.
  • Deep Sea Soup and Summer Salad are high-tier recipes that use both foraged and grown ingredients to restore a significant amount of health and stamina.

Fields of Mistria is an incredible spiritual successor to the farming simulator RPGs that were released in the late 90s, with this early access game already hooking players with its adorable art style, interesting characters, and even better story of helping a town after an earthquake. Like many old-school farming simulator titles, players won't be able to get everything done in a single day due to each activity eating into their stamina bar.

However, players can make their energy last longer by cooking various interesting recipes in a kitchen like that found inside the Inn, where each recipe can replenish a fair amount of health and stamina. With such an assortment of drinks, meals, and snacks to create, these are by far the best food items in Fields of Mistri a for players, no matter what point in the game they are at.

8 Trail Mix

An Easy Recipe Made Through Foraging In Spring

  • 12 Health
  • 12 Stamina

Trail Mix is one of the simplest recipes a player will learn early into the exploration of Fields of Mistria, by using two ingredients that players can get their hands on in abundance while exploring in this farming simulator.

As long as the player has enough time to spend in the inn creating Trail Mix, this easy foraging snack is one of many great starting stamina replenishes that players will want to take a fair amount into the Mines with them so that they can likely make it to deeper levels.

Kitchen Tier

1

Cooking Skill

1

Ingredients

  • 2 Water Chestnut
  • 1 Wild Berries

7 Berries And Cream

A Great Way To Use Milk And Sell It For More

  • 16 Health
  • 16 Stamina

While wild berries are something players are likely to get early in the game, Berries, and Cream, unlike Trail Mix, is something a player will likely be creating during the mid-game of their playtime with Fields of Mistria. Berries and Cream is a recipe players will likely create due to the profit from selling this delicious dessert being a minor profit on the base selling price of milk.

While this isn't something that makes a major profit, it's still a great way for those who are trying to make some extra Tessarae and want another reason for keeping cows other than the story of the game and their cuteness.

Kitchen Tier

1

Cooking Skill

1

Ingredients

  • 6 Wild Berries
  • 1 Milk

6 Sliced Turnip

One Of The Earliest Ways To Gain Stamina

  • 18 Health
  • 18 Stamina

Returning to food items that players will be using early into the playthrough, especially during the Spring, Sliced Turnip is another great choice for players looking for a crop they can make in abundance and then use afterward to create a decent meal to replenish their stamina or health.

As Spring's quickest and cheapest crop to grow, players can create many fields of turnips so they can create an abundance of Sliced Turnip, which will likely be the one meal players rely on once they have finally unlocked the Mines in Fields of Mistria.

Kitchen Tier

1

Cooking Skill

1

Ingredients

  • 1 Turnip

5 Coconut Milk

A Great Way To Get Stamina In Summer

  • 18 Health
  • 18 Stamina

When the season finally changes to summer in Fields of Mistria, players will also be unable to grow any more turnips. However, all is not lost as summer sees the player able to forage for a new food source, that being coconuts.

Once the player has sold a coconut, they will receive the recipe to make Coconut Milk; a refreshing drink made for the summer heat, in their mailbox the next day. Giving players the same amount of stamina and health as Sliced Turnips do, this is a perfect replacement which also doesn't require the player to purchase their own seeds.

Kitchen Tier

1

Cooking Skill

1

Ingredients

  • 1 Coconut

4 Grilled Corn

Sells For More Than Regular Corn

  • 24 Health
  • 24 Stamina

As mentioned, cooking crops is a great way to earn an extra bit of profit. This becomes an even better idea when growing crops like corn in the summer, which takes 5 days to grow and then regrows every 3 days in Fields of Mistria.

By then cooking this corn into Grilled Corn, players can make an additional profit of 10 Tessarae, as long as they have the time in the day to cook their entire field's worth of corn. This is also another great stamina food source due to each Grilled Corn also giving the player 24 health and stamina, which is an extra boost compared to the Coconut Milk.

Kitchen Tier

1

Cooking Skill

2

Ingredients

  • 1 Corn

3 Green Tea

A Replenishing Way To Gain Stamina

  • 24 Health
  • 24 Stamina

Tea is one of many incredibly useful crops that can be grown during the summer once the player has upgraded the General Store. With tea being brewed into an assortment of different types of teas, one of the most common and easiest to brew is a simple Green Tea.

With the final product giving players the same amount of stamina and health as replenished by Grilled Corn, some players may question how it is better to be created than Grilled Corn. Besides being a great way to get stamina back, Green Tea also sells for more than Grilled Corn and makes a great gift for befriending the likes of Josephine and Valen too.

Kitchen Tier

1

Cooking Skill

2

Ingredients

  • 1 Tea

2 Deep Sea Soup

Using Things Found In The Caves To Stay Full

  • 52 Health
  • 52 Stamina

Some of the best meals to be made in Fields of Mistria are those that use the ingredients found while exploring, instead of the crops that have been planted for profit. That's why unlocking recipes like the Deep Sea Soup is so perfect for any player hoping to spend their days mining for various artifacts and minerals within the Mines.

Deep Sea Soup makes the most of the different items that can be foraged within the Tide Caverns area of the Mines and then replenishes an incredible amount of stamina and health while giving the player a reason for keeping them after donating one of each ingredient to the Museum.

Kitchen Tier

1

Cooking Skill

12

Ingredients

  • 1 Jade Dulsa
  • 1 Mines Mussels
  • 1 Underseaweed

1 Summer Salad

Restores A Large Amount Of Health And Stamina Through The Labors Of Summer

  • 120 Health
  • 120 Stamina

Out of all the available recipes in Fields of Mistria , by far one of the best that players should create once they have all the ingredients available is the Summer Salad. This recipe is perfect for players who have had a focus on growing the various crops in summer and keeping a hold of at least two or three of each crop to make a few of these salads.

Besides replenishing a large amount of stamina and health, the Summer Salad also sells for 450 Tessarae, meaning overall, players make a 65 Tessarae profit from selling this salad instead of the ingredients separately. However, this is likely to be a beginner recipe for players due to requiring a higher cooking skill.

Kitchen Tier

2

Cooking Skill

28

Ingredients

  • 1 Cucumber
  • 1 Chili Pepper
  • 1 Tomato
  • 1 Corn
